channel.title: Happy Australia Day! ~ 2007!
channel.description: [center][img]http://www.google.com.au/logos/australia_day07.gif[/img][img]http://z.about.com/d/webclipart/1/0/v/M/2/aus1st.gif[/img] [img]http://i1.trekearth.com/photos/1861/australia_day_fireworks_3_sm.jpg[/img][img]http://www.israellycool.com/australia%20day.jpg[/img] [/center] [center][size=25pt]HappyAustralia[color=green]Day![/color][/size][/center] [hr] [center]I Know all of you arnt auzzies. but this is directed at people who are :)[/center] [hr] [center][img]http://www.sfrg.mysamford.com.au/images/SFRG%20Australia%20Day%202006%20Certificate-lg.jpg[/img][/center]

item.title: Happy Australia Day! ~ 2007!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The Big Day Out organisers probably read the papers, too.

However, I honestly don’t know too much about the australian situation having never been there, but from where I’m standing it looks the same as the UK situation - “Those fuckin pakis, they rape our women and beat our men - let’s go smack em up”.

Six of one and half a dozen of the other etc.

EDIT: Actually, fuck “six of one”. Nine of one and three of the other.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Australia Day! ~ 2007!
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

*Young adults, Mopman. And you can hardly call quotes lies.
If you’re Australian and watch the news, you would have seen the quotes from the muslim leader. Secondly, video footage doesn’t lie either, especially when it’s from security cameras. Not to mention footage on the televisions of what they have the balls to say to police officers.

And if what I said about their violence is untrue, then why were the organisers of Big Day Out so worried that they attempted to ban Australian flags on the day due to the high risk of riot outbreaks. Go figure.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Australia Day! ~ 2007!
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:30, topic:51894”][quote author=Kamu link=topic=72925.msg828207#msg828207 date=1169895876]

Oh ffs, you daft niggers have your own DAY? Where’s England day?

Mopman, c’mon. Don’t act like a racist. Please try not to use that word in a derogatory context.

I think he was joking. =\ Besides, I’d be a hypocrite if I complained seeing as I don’t like lebs in Australia. Can’t walk outside after 5pm at night in Sydney if you want to make it home untouched lmfao.

Woah, are you being serious?
Not like that at all in WA.
[/quote]
Mate, if a girl walks past a group of filthy lebs she gets raped. If you’re a guy that goes to help her, you get gang bashed.
EDIT: And that’s in broad daylight too.[/quote]

I love the media. It fills our children with such insightful and correct views on the world.

Read full topic

item.title: Happy Australia Day! ~ 2007!
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“lothy, post:32, topic:51894”][quote author=apzrman link=topic=72925.msg829022#msg829022 date=1169910919]
the muslim leader even thinks that muslims have more right to b in australia than decendants of the convicts
[/quote]
The muslim leader said women were like meat - and that it was their fault if anything happened.
Oh, and let’s not forget how there was ‘allegedly’ going to be an attack on a muslim synagogue or whatever. So the filth got together and then when nothing happened, they went on a big fun fest fucking up people’s cars, and damaging anything they came across.
Not to mention that the whole Crunulla riots were started because of an attack on some Australian life guards by a group of 10+ lebanese ‘men’. Then when another guy saw this and went over to help, the mob turned on him.

Dirty fuckers need to get out of our country - After all, do we want Australia to look like this in 10 years:

Or do we want it to look like this:

I certainly hope Australia is still like the first picture.

Call me racist, but before you make such a bold remark be sure to know what you’re talking about if you disagree.[/quote]

I don’t live in Australia but I have relatives that live out there and I go and visit them quite often. So i agree with you.

Read full topic
